release.action: Monitor payload size check at creation time.
DBE_PROPERTY support.
JNIException class made public.
JNI CA Status check before DBR creation patch by Ike.
Added support for -Djca.use_env=true - reads EPICS system env. variables.
Mac OS X 10.6 (Intel) support.
QueuedEventDispatcher and LastMonitorOnlyEventDispatcher concurrency improvements.
PUT_ACKT/ACKS support added.
Mac OS X (Intel) support.
JNI processing fixed in case of error.
QueuedEventDispatcher deadlock detection added (if queue is full and event is generated by event dispatcher queue).

Clean implementation of JNI AttachCurrentThread/DeattachCurrentThread. AttachCurrentThreadAsDaemon used instead of AttachCurrentThread (to let JVM to exit if not using EPICS 3.14.9 or newer). JDK 1.4 or newer required by AttachCurrentThreadAsDaemon.
Ported part of CAJ tests to test JCA.
JNIMonitor.removeMonitorListener() implementation did actually add a monitor listener. Fixed.
JNIChannel.get() threw a NullPointerException if channel not connected. Fixed to throw CAException.
64-bit platform support added (32-bit pointers replaced with 64-bit).
JNI context initialization bug fixed.
JNI global context message callback fallback fixed. Unused getEnvPtr/freeEnvPtr on non-BSD4.3 systems excluded from build.
Priority support added..
QueuedEventDispatcher improved (blocks per PV).
Added code to destroy event dispatcher to JNIContext.
Added support for ServerContext and some changes to DBRs.
Eclipse compatibility, exception callbacks, use of epicsThreadPrivate. (fix provided by Kenneth Evans, Jr.)
Added CAStatus.UNRESPTMO (virtual circuit unresponsive) status.
Added ContextExceptionListener.contextVirtualCircuitException() method.
gov.aps.jca.event.DirectEventDispatcher - added exception handling of exceptions thrown from user code.
Minor performance/memory improvement on enums types.
Malformed JavaDocs fixed.
I fixed a bug that was overwriting memory in JNI.cpp. (fix provided by Tom Pelaia)
I added support for building and running JCA on Mac OS X. (update provided by Tom Pelaia)

Simplified the OS scripts by using the EPICS environment variables to eliminate the hard coded paths so users will no longer have to edit these files for their setup. Now build system uses the EPICS_BASE_RELEASE and EPICS_EXTENSIONS environment variables that EPICS users use for referencing the EPICS base and extensions folders respectively. (update provided by Tom Pelaia)
Added gov.aps.jca.Context.getVersion() method. Now users can retrieve context name and version information (at runtime).

Added global context configuration defined in JCALibrary.property. Prefix gov.aps.jca.Context can be used instead of specific prefixes to set global context configuration. Of course, specific configuration overrides default configuration(s).

release.description: Minor bugfix and CAJ context constant added.
release.action: Added gov.aps.jca.JCALibrary.CHANNEL_ACCESS_JAVA property.
gov.aps.jca.jni.JNI.ctxt_pool() was always throwing a CAException due to the fact that the ca_poll() function in the C library always returns a timeout status code (fix provided by Eric Boucher).
Major synchonization and performance fixes in gov.aps.jca.event.QueuedEventDispatcher.
gov.aps.jca.event.DirectEventDispatcher minor performance improvement.
gov.aps.jca.JCALibrary.getInstance() singleton pattern was missing synchronization.
Removed unused imports in the code.
